Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What's wrong Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I got gum in my hair.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This just stinks. Don't touch it, please don't touch it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You've got a ton of dandruff.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, let me be.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How'd you get gum in your hair?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I was walking in and I noticed something shinny under Stanley's car and I got under to see what it was and I messed up my hair, all for a stupid piece of tinfoil.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But best case scenario, you thought it was a quarter.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kill me... right now.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We have peanut butter in the kitchen.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't feel like peanut butter. Get me an ice cream sandwich.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope. Not for you it's for your hair, and it is 9 am.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No Dwight, not the good peanut butter. People are going to get mad.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, hey, hey. This is my hair we're talking about.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Smells good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Taste good too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh don't. That's disgusting.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wow! Lot of calories.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well just don't leave it on too long. Keep massaging please. Ah yeah, that's nice.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey Michael, how was your date last night?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will be honest; the dating has not been going well. Look, men are visual creatures. We crave beauty, like a piece of fine art by any number of renowned artists, or an arty photograph of Cindy Crawford nude... that, but the women I'm getting fixed up with are, egh! Not that they aren't nice, or that have great personalities, they just... They just lack a certain... Crawfordness.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I am livid, Absolutely livid.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's ridiculous.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yes, I'm having the Scranton branch come in on one Saturday so they can re-enter sales that they made on the phone as sales that were made by the website which they should have done in the first place, if the website had been working.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: My favorite branch. How's everybody doing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey man, you mind if I run something by you?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Love it. Go.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I kinda feel like what we have going for us is our customer service, and no matter how we change this up, I don't know that a website's going to be able to replace that.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I can tell you thought about this a lot, I appreciate that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: David Wallace does too. You told him all about this at the Christmas party, right?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Did I? I don't...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You did. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Watch your back Jim. I'm just kidding.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ladies and Gentlemen, may I have your attention please. I know that a lot of you are very angry with Ryan because he is the reason we all have to come in tomorrow, however, I swear to God, If any of you hurts him in any way emotionally or taunts him or makes fun of his height or his half beard or...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Ok thanks Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm here today to do some creative problem solving about Dunder Mifflin Infinity and field your questions.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Question.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why am I being forced to come in tomorrow and pretend that a website made sales that I made?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: This is a temporary measure to increase the legitimacy of the site.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I don't like when my clients call me to help them use the website, I'm not seeing commissions on that.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I hear you Stanley, that is a great observation. Problems like that will not happen when we launch Dunder Mifflin Infinity 2 point O.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: When will that be?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: TBD. Phyllis?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Did the police solve the problem with the...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yes, yes they did, yes they did.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yes, the social networking feature of the Dunder Mifflin Infinity website was infiltrated by sexual predators.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't understand why our website has to have social networking at all.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, I actually have to agree with Dwight on that one.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: It's all about creating a one stop shop consumer experience, alright? You're chatting with your friends, you're talking about the latest music, about the election; all of it is happening in our virtual paper store.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And then an older gentleman asked you "Boxers or briefs?"

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I don't get the big fuss here, I like the site.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: If I'd have created a website with as many problems, I'd kill myself.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Do you have a question Kelly?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah I have a lot of questions. Number one, how dare you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [slow clapping] Ryan has done a very good job, and I am not applauding sarcastically. Think about it, a month ago nobody would go on this site because we were worried about getting molested, or losing our identity, having it stolen. But now, at a time TDB, all of the problems will be in the past. Ya done good kid, ya done good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well it has been nice seeing you again my friend.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh Ryan, I need a girlfriend so bad. [hugs Ryan]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Michael let me go. Let me go Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Argh. Alright. Do you know any girls in New York you might want to hook me up with? Some that might be interested in a guy like me.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Na.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Na?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Sorry man.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well you tried.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: But seriously, you should see the girls I meet at clubs in the city.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Unreal.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They sound great.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Bye everyone. Stay real Scranton, alright. Peace.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Would you have sex with Meredith?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you think she'd keep it quiet?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm gonna go to my desk.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim, it's not the horniness, ok it's the loneliness that...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's go to New York. We'll go clubbing with Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I can't.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes you can, you're single, I'm single. It'll be awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm not single.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who you dating?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's still going on?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, Dwight grab your stuff, we're going to New York to party with Ryan and to meet girls.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh yes! Count me in dudes. I am in some serious need of some bro' time. Old ball and chain's been a lot more chain than ball lately if you know what I'm saying.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'm right here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, singles only, singles only. Also three is unlucky. Curse of three.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sorry Andy. Cannot take any chances on curses, not tonight. Let's go. Everybody, I will see you tomorrow, Saturday morning, probably wearing the same clothes that I am wearing right now, If you catch my drift.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: We get it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am going to go get laid. Goodbye.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [laughs] With sex!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's... I, I think that...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what? If we all stayed a couple of hours late tonight without Michael distracting us, we wouldn't have to come in at all tomorrow.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So I caught everyone before they left and I told them my idea, and they loved it. Because this is a group that respects good ideas... the one time a year they hear one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ryan's assistant told us that he would be at this club this evening. It is called Prerogative.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Place is packed.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Fire hazard.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Packed with beautiful babies. Swingers. Classic. John Favreau, tall guy from DodgeBall.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Women look like white slaves.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, they're just hotties.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I don't know man, when you think about it, Cabo's really the third world. I don't go to a place like that to see more poverty you know. You go there to get some glamour.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What are you doing here?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well you know, just taking you up on your offer to party, so tada.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: That is so awesome man!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: And you brought this guy!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Aww!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ryan, it's Michael and Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I know it's you guys.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm so psyched you're here!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Woooo!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Let's get a drink.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's do it!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks a lot guys, Good job.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Later.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nice job everybody. Great work.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Did you not tell the security guard we were working late?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope. I didn't, but let's go inside and I can call him right now.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You can't, I locked the office from the inside when we left.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Perfect, you guys worked together on this one. If I'm not in my bath with a glass of red wine in an hour, you're both dead.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: There is a master key and a spare key for the office. Dwight has them both. When I asked, "What if you die Dwight, how will we get into the office?" He said, "If I'm dead, you guys have been dead for weeks."

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Guys, I want you to meet a really good friend of mine, this is Troy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, nice to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Troy
Quote.Text: Hey, how ya doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, Dwight. You resemble a Tolkien character.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Ah, he basically is man. He's a regular banking wizard.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, no. Not a wizard, a hobbit.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Bottle service ya'll?

Quote.Text: We don't serve food here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you live in a regular sized house?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah. He's a normal guy, he's cool.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You really don't have his phone number?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I told you, I have the number that rings here. Do you want that number?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I might have it in here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Aw! That's great Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It's so random that I have it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Toby, you're the best.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: When I put it in I thought it would be a waste of time, but I guess it was worth it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Great, It's under here as Security Guard home. Did you not get his name? Or...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's ringing. Does anybody have his name? Quick.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes, it's Eddie.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's not, it's not Eddie, it's ah, Evan or...

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Hank, his name is Hank.

Quote.Speaker: Jim

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Elliot.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Elliot!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is it Elliot? Hey ch... chief, this is Jim Halpert from um... where you work. You're the guy who sits behind the desk... you're, you're the, the Afri... African-American guy, I mean you're. Ah... Who, Who've I got here?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Dwight Schrute man. How's Schrute Farms?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: This guy owns his own beet farm.

Quote.Speaker: Troy
Quote.Text: Insane.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well it's weevil season but we were prepared.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Weevils, what a crazy word man. What? I don't even know what that means. What does that mean?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: They lay their eggs inside the unripe beet root, then come spring time the babies eat their way out.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Crazy. That's too much for me man, I'm gonna hit the bathroom.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You've already been several times.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Maybe you have some kinda bladder infection.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I don't know, maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll order you some cranberry juice.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: With vodka, you're the best.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to troy] Do you have powers?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on phone] Oh thank you Hank. You are a lifesaver, Hank. Appreciate it. [to office co-workers] Alright, so Hank is gonna come down here and he's gonna let us all out. [lowers voice] He said it should just be under an hour, so... [everyone groans] we did it.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: We should all make sure to give him a big tip this Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Sorry guys, but I don't think I tipped him for last year's.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yeah, neither did I.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Jim was supposed to collect it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yup...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Way to go, man.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Now he's never gonna come.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: By a show of hands, who thinks we're a better couple than Jim and Pam? [people raise hands]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Phyllis.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I umm, thought about getting a tattoo on my back as well at one point. I was thinking about getting "Back to the Future." "Back" because it's on my back and "Future" because I'm the kind of guy who likes to look ahead into the future. I just think a tattoo should mean something, you know? And it's my second favorite movie.

Quote.Text: I've never heard of that movie.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Back to the Future? [she shakes head] Oh, wow. Well you should take a, a film education course.

Quote.Text: One of you guys can have the sofa, and one of you guys can have...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I got sofa. I got sofa.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, I'm the boss.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I got floor.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Case anyone needs to go to the bathroom in the middle of the night, I don't wannna get my head stepped on.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to Ryan] Do you want me to sing you a song my mother used to sing me, when we were sick?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No. [Dwight starts singing in German]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, shh shh. Dwight. Leave him alone.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's a lullaby.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shh. Ryan, Ryan, we're going to take your clothes off.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No. Guys, I think my friend Troy might have a drug problem. What do I do?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I think his species might have a higher tolerance than ours.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shh, just stop. Here's what you do. You tell him that you're his friend and that you're gonna help him and that everyone's gonna be all right. And then you put a wire on him and you find out who's selling him drugs and then you get that guy and you flip up, turn him into a snitch. You follow that guy to the people who's really really bad. Been watching The Wire recently. I don't understand a word of it.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Guys, I'm going to sleep. You can leave the light on if you want, but please stop talking, OK?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK. Good night Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Best night ever.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Like I said, it's not about the horniness, it's about the loneliness. And how can I be lonely with my boys? Like a famous person once said, Boys on the side. But I don't, I disagree, I say... let's hear it for the boys.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: [drives up to parking lot to notice all the office cars are gone] Son of a bitch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're gonna be okay, it's gonna...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ohhh, man! [sound of Ryan throwing up] There it goes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ahh, ooh!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am so sorry. I'm so sorry, sir.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [helping Ryan out of the taxi] Come on, come on.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That'll come out of the upholstery. Oh, man. He threw up in the back of the taxi.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Dehydration.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here we go, let's sit down.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's dehydration. He went to the bathroom at the club like fifteen times.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, shhh. Dwight, leave him alone.

Quote.Speaker: Troy
Quote.Text: Hey, don't blame me for what Ryan does. I'm not his dad. I'm his friend, okay? And friends are there to help you have a good time. And sell you the stuff you need to have a good time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You had a rough night tonight. But your life is very good, my friend. You've got a great job, you... you can have any woman you want, you're good looking, you, you know...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Friends with a hobbit.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Frien..sss...yes, you're friends with a hobbit, and... look where you live. I mean, you've got it all.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, New York is great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I mean this apartment building, it's fantastic.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh, this, this is not my apartment. This, this is the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, now I can say that I went to a museum.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [Phyllis, Pam, Toby, and Oscar are sharing iPod headphones] I don't understand. Which one is that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's the other Boleyn girl.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Honestly, the book is so much better than this.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Shh.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [through the fence to Terri, who's holding a drink for him to sip] Ah, we don't know. They didn't give him his Christmas bonus this year, so...

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: [on phone] Stop calling me so I can put on my damn socks!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Will do. [hangs up] I'll stop calling. [walks into lobby]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Was he still there?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, that was his wife, so he's on his way.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Jim, how long? I have to go to the bathroom.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, he'll be here really soon, Kev.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: If you hadn't made us stay, we'd all be home by now.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Somebody's always got to be a hero.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I'm so cold, I'm gonna faint. If I faint, it's totally your fault, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Let's be honest, it's not totally my fault. [indicates Pam] Shared responsibility.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mmm?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I just mean if you, if you didn't lock the door, then we could be upstairs where it's warmer.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm supposed to turn the lock when I leave, it's part of my job.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is that... I didn't know that was your... okay, so we're in agreement, this is not ideal... situation.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ryan?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you ever miss us?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Not really. New York is...so great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ryan?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you remember what color my eyes are?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hazel. They're hazel.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, I asked him.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No, I, I was going to say hazel, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Not just because he said it?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ryan?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You're my friend, Michael. OK?
